alert.note: Alert for Greater Portland Metro Area (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 26 at 7:41PM PST until February 27 at 11:00AM PST by NWS Portland
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 10 PM THIS EVENING TO 11 AM PST MONDAY... * WHAT...Wet snow expected. Widespread snowfall of 0.5 to 1 inch with up to 2 inches at elevations above 500 feet. Most of the snow is expected Monday morning. * WHERE...Greater Portland Metro Area. * WHEN...From 10 PM this evening to 11 AM PST Monday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...May see accumulations up to 3 inches near the mouth of the Gorge and the upper elevations near the West Hills.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1, or visit for Oregon: https://www.tripcheck.com and for Washington: https://wsdot.com/travel/real-time/map
